timeline.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText:
Dealing with leech is really an action only done while scheduling. I believe that this is the place where it makes the most sens.
The only reason I can see for a hook in leech, upstream, is that showing the tooltip is a front-end action and not a back-end one. So the code is in the reviewer and not in the scheduler.
I could also put this in the Reviewer as a static method, and call it from Scheduler. I really don't see the point of a whole class just to show a toast
